prompt: Think back to the time when you were able to prevent yourself from smoking. What made it different from when you did smoke?
response: i wasnt able to concentrate and was very ratty
reflection_gpt: Your ability to stop smoking is related to your concentration level, which in turn depends on how much nicotine you are taking in. If you take too little nicotine, you will be unable to control your urge to smoke. On the other hand, if you take too much nicotine, you may become addicted to nicotine and lose all motivation to quit. The best way to determine whether you need more nicotine is to use an electronic cigarette (e-cigarette). Electronic cigarettes deliver nicotine through inhalation of vaporized liquid that contains no tobacco. They also contain flavorings such as fruit flavors, mints, menthol, and chocolate. E-cigarettes can help smokers who cannot quit because they find it difficult to focus while trying to hold their breath for long periods of time. However, e-cigarettes should only be used under medical supervision.
reflection_human: Not smoking made you less focused.

reflection_gpt: I'm not sure what this means but let me try and explain it for you. Smoking has been around since before recorded history. It started as an alternative way to get high. People used tobacco because they didn't have access to other drugs such as alcohol or marijuana. They also smoked because it gave them a sense of control over their lives. Nowadays we know that smoking causes cancer, heart disease, emphysema, lung diseases, strokes, respiratory infections, and many more problems. We are all aware of these dangers so why do people continue to smoke? Why does anyone want to be associated with something that can kill them? If you're still interested in learning more about smoking then check out my book "Smoking Kills" which will help you understand the negative effects of smoking.

reflection_gpt: and then i would just stop and go home and do nothing
reflection_human: You don't like how others perceive your smoking.

reflection_human: Smoking helps you relax.

prompt: Please desccribe a situation where you thought about being a good role model and that cause you not to smoke
response: At a childrens birthday party I was detemined not to be seen as a smoker
reflection_gpt: You think people will judge you for smoking.
reflection_human: You don't like being seen as a smoker.

prompt: Please describe a time where you experienced stress and didn’t end up smoking
response: I was in the waiting room of the emergency room and felt stressed but it was more important to stay with famioy
reflection_gpt: Stress is bad for you.

prompt: Think back to the time when you were able to prevent yourself from smoking. What made it different from when you did smoke?

prompt: Think back to the time when you were able to prevent yourself from smoking. What made it different from when you did smoke?
response: nothing really comes to mind sorry

prompt: Think back to the time when you were able to prevent yourself from smoking. What made it different from when you did smoke?
response: just distaction really and not staying too still
reflection_gpt: Distraction helps you stay focused on something other than smoking.

prompt: Please describe a situation where you thought about being a good role model and that cause you not to smoke
response: i have really tried to stop i have focused on telling my daughter where i am wrong and why she should stay well away from smoking
reflection_gpt: You told her how much better life was without smoking.
reflection_human: You do not want your kids to start smoking.

prompt: Please describe a time where you had a compelling feeling to smoke but didn't end up smoking
response: When I had got off an airplane after a long journey.
reflection_gpt: This was a very important moment in your life.

prompt: Please describe a time where you experienced stress and didn't end up smoking
response: When I am working, my job is quite stressful at times

prompt: Please describe a time where you contemplated the consequences of smoking on your health and ended up smoking
response: I had a hard time running but still continued to smoke anyhow and missed my bus
reflection_gpt: Your decision to continue smoking despite having health concerns led to an unhealthy lifestyle.
reflection_human: You saw how your health was affected by smoking.

prompt: Let me see if I recall correctly, so you think of Stigma or shame as something bad about smoking Please express a time where you experienced social stigma but still ended up smoking

reflection_human: You had to smoke alone.

prompt: Let me see if I recall correctly, so you think of Physical appearance as something bad about smoking Please describe a time where you thought about the effect of smoking on your appearance but ended up smoking

prompt: I see, you get pleasure from smoking What else do you find positive about smoking?
